title: Motion of piston in sealed cylinder

content.question: A sealed horizontal insulated cylinder with cross-sectional area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is divided into two chambers with equal volume <math alttext="V sub 0 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> by a piston with mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The left chamber is filled with a gas at pressure <math alttext="P sub L" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>L</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and the right chamber is filled with a gas at pressure <math alttext="P sub R " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The piston moves with negligible friction and is initially at rest. The piston is pushed to the left, reducing the volume on the left to <math alttext="the fraction V sub 0 over 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and then released from rest. Which of the following claims about the motion of the piston as it returns to its original position is correct? Assume the positive direction is to the right.

choices.label: The piston moves to the right with positive velocity and negative acceleration.
The piston moves to the right with positive velocity and zero acceleration.
The piston moves to the right with positive velocity and positive acceleration.
The piston moves to the right with negative velocity and negative acceleration.

content.answer: The piston moves to the right with positive velocity and positive acceleration.
